entry.title: Add with_mte.py
entry.content:
Enabling/disabling MTE (Arm Memory Tagging Extension) requires a

reboot after running setprop. with_mte.py is a wrapper

script for tests that will enable MTE on the device for the

duration of the test.



bootctl property is set to MTE for the device.

We still need to enable MTE per app.

Chrome and tests enables MTE by default through the AndroidManifest.xml

https://source.android.com/docs/security/test/memory-safety/arm-mte#enable-mte-apps

And PartitionAlloc initialization will change the MTE mode to what is specified in Feature flags.

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:base/allocator/partition_alloc_support.cc;drc=f4a00cc248dd2dc8ec8759fb51620d47b5114090;l=1159



Bug: 40268661

Change-Id: Id4f4dad1efb7eaea6d7efe5ca51fe1031bfd6fe2

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5273111

entry.title: Make PaintTimingVisualizer a TraceLog::EnabledStateObserver.
entry.content:
This allows us to ensure that it outputs a viewport event each time

tracing starts. This fixes problems where the viewport is not output

in every trace when the same page load is traced multiple times.



Ensuring the viewport event is in each trace allows post-load analysis

like this one for soft navigations:

https://calendar.perfplanet.com/2023/digging-chrome-traces-introduction-example/



Change-Id: I3b2a148e7ebfb1a7f323a0fdb82fe30bb87c7cb7

Reviewed-by: Michal Mocny

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1263789}

entry.title: Files app: Fix some errors calling the private API
entry.content:
This CL fixes the following errors, identified from console.warn()

messages.



Error calling getDriveQuotaMetadata() from GearMenuController and

BannerController. These log errors happened when switching from a

non-Drive volume directly into Offline or Shared with me sections

within Google Drive, because those are fake entries.



Error trying to share a non-native entry with Crostini/GuestOS. Some

entries in the directory tree are non-native, like EntryList for

grouped USB partitions or GuestOS placeholders. These shouldn't be

shareable anyway.



Fixed: b:324872593

Change-Id: I3ab62c35147911cc2392e2bf0d69dafd0fcd77bd

entry.title: [cleanup] Remove Length::IsNegative and Length::IsPositive.
entry.content:
There methods were needed previously primarily for legacy layout table

logic, but were super dangerous if not called on the correct type.



The only user now was line-height:normal. Which used a sentinel value

of Length::Percent(-100) to indicate "normal".



Replace this sentinel with Length::Auto() instead.



There should be no behaviour change.

entry.title: arc: Add active audio throttle observer
entry.content:
Create a new throttle observer that will be active when there is an

active audio stream from ARC.



This prevents ARC from being throttled while the user is listening

to music or video in the background, as it can cause audio glitches on

low performance devices.



BUG=b:318784459

TEST=Unit test in CQ

TEST=1. Set #arc-unthrottle-on-active-audio flag to default

2. Play audio from Oboetester in background

3. Check /sys/fs/cgroup/cpu/arcvm/cpu.shares is 64

TEST=1. Enable #arc-unthrottle-on-active-audio flag

2. Play audio from Oboetester in background

3. Check /sys/fs/cgroup/cpu/arcvm/cpu.shares is 1024

entry.title: [ProtegoPing] Add a new metric to log protego pings over 7 days
entry.content:
This change defines a new histogram called

SafeBrowsing.Enhanced.ProtegoRequestSentInLast7Days which is similar to

SafeBrowsing.Enhanced.ProtegoRequestSentIn24Hours. The difference is

that the new metric will record a type of WithToken or WithoutToken if a

ping was sent any time in the last 7 days.



We're landing this change so that we can get better visibility into how

many users are really logging None on each platform. Our hypothesis is

that if we look at the last ping across 7 days, then we'll see many less

None values logged. This will help us better understand the breakdown of

Protego ping composition in the Protego server logs.



This change also renames the method in the

safe_browsing_metrics_collector to `MaybeLogDailyEsbProtegoPingSent` to

better represent the contents -- since it no longer only logs values

related to 24 hours.



Change-Id: I0a8407dc9a0070b1bf55eb851970c6df9a144303

Bug: 326116362, 326275043

entry.title: enable speak content under the pointer on PWA and WV2
entry.content:
Bug: 323771594



Implements accessibility hit testing for RemoteCocoa so that Speak Content under the pointer can read the accessible objects under the user's pointer.



This comes from a commit:https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3861171 in 2022/9/9 and was reverted on 2023/2/8. The reason why it was reverted is that it causes some macOS tools hangs and OOMs.



Now to resolve A11y related issues(such as hover text or Speak Content under the pointer), I want to re-land it with a feature flag in accessibility_features.h named kAccessibilityRemoteUIApp.

entry.title: Create break tokens for OOFs, both before and inside.
entry.content:
Clean up SimplifiedOofLayoutAlgorithm somewhat, by removing

SetShouldAddBreakTokensManually(). It used to set this flag in the

fragment builder, in order to prevent break tokens from an OOF from

being added at all, so that they wouldn't be copied over to new

fragmentainers when copying all the child break tokens of the old

fragments in SimplifiedOofLayoutAlgorithm().



If we instead allow OOFs to add break tokens as normally, and make sure

that only in-flow child break tokens are copied over in

SimplifiedOofLayoutAlgorithm(), things should be fine.



Also document why we in some cases need to copy over child break tokens.

This is only needed when being interrupted by column spanners, so skip

it in all other cases.



Finally, make it a strict requirement that if a fragmentainer is to be

followed by another, it always gets an outgoing break token. Nobody

currently depends on this, but paginated layout (for printing) will

soon. This is also more consistent. It's a bit unexpected to have a

break-token-less fragment even though it's followed by another one.



No behavior changes intended.



Change-Id: Ia89fe48ac3ab35ec99f9e39055d394be5178f155

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5314380

Reviewed-by: Alison Maher

Commit-Queue: Morten Stenshorne

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1263749}

entry.title: [dPWA] Improve tracking of the PWA install dialog
entry.content:
Previously, the PWA install bubble was tracked with a global raw_ptr to

the bubble in the anonymous namespace with a static getter. This CL

makes that better by:

1. Introducing a new coordinator class that is responsible for tracking

if the dialog is being shown.

2. The class is now tied to the BrowserUserData, so the dialog can be

easily tracked even if it is not being shown.

entry.content:
This CL adds following histograms:

1. Boolean histogram "Android.EdgeToEdge.Eligible" to indicate whether

the current page is eligible. Record once for each launch.

2. Enumerate Histogram "Android.EdgeToEdge.IneligibilityReason" to track

the reason why it is not eligible. Multiple records possible for each

launch.

actually drawn to edge.

entry.title: Always use GetURLLoaderOptions() in NavigationURLLoaderImpl
entry.content:
To unify the logic, and particularly to use the same options

for initial SW-intercepted requests and its fallback requests.



This is preparation for

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5274112

that will plumb the opitions from the initial SW-intercepted requests

and fallback requests, instead of asking or duplicating the

`NavigationURLLoaderImpl` logic.



This CL shouldn't change the behavior, because this CL uses

`GetURLLoaderOptions()` for WebUI, blob and intercepted requests,

but the option flags set in `GetURLLoaderOptions()` are not checked

in the URLLoaderFactories etc. for these requests, according to

code search.

entry.title: [chromecast] Use MediaSession methods instead of MediaSessionImpl.
entry.content:
These Impl methods (the static fromWebContents() and the

non-static requestSystemAudioFocus() methods) have been

upstreamed to the public MediaSession base interface, so we can

break the dependency on content.browser, and only directly use

classes in content_public.



Bug: 326107481

Test: cast_shell_junit_tests

entry.title: [dPWA] Make WebAppIconDiagnostic checks be a command
entry.content:
This CL makes the task that runs diagnostics on icons for a web app

into a command, so that it can be run in isolation in the web apps

system without other web app operations interfering with it.



Technically this should be a no-op, except that the behavior now is

more async than before due to this being a command, but it still

should be fine.



This is a code health follow-up to the crbug.com/324502954.



Bug: 325094641

Change-Id: I2db587bf9c83eac1b77d841c93b93f4f533a83f4

entry.title: Updates policy info if any of the policy blob contains a new key.
entry.content:
This would make Omaha 4 the same behavior as Omaha 3. The change is a

possible cause of the policy validation failure rate too high alert.



Original behavior:

Updates the policy info if the first policy blob (in a map) contains

a new key. This is based on the assumption that each of policy blobs

contains the same new key or none of them has a key. This is

questionable.



Bug: 323479127

entry.title: oak birch: integrate birch bar to Overview
entry.content:
This cl integrates the birch bar to Overview grid. We mainly

simulate how the desk bar was added to the Overview.



The cl made following changes:

- Add a relayout callback list to BirchBarView which will be called

after birch bar relayout with the relayout reason. With this, the

overview grid could reposition the windows when the birch bar

bounds change due to adding or removing chips.

- Only create the secondary chips row of birch bar when it holds

chips. Otherwise, there will always be child spacing between two

rows.

- Add birch bar view, birch bar widget attributes to OverviewGrid.

- Initialize, update, and destroy the birch bar for certain

conditions.

- Separate the overview grid paddings calculation into two

functions since calculating birch bar bounds needs the horizontal

paddings to estimate available space. Vertical paddings calculation

needs the accurate birch bar bounds.

- Add unit tests for birch bar.



Test: BirchBarTest.* All/BirchBarLayoutTest.*

Bug: b:324144400

Change-Id: I4364e4e5fa29db656e2e4a76403437146f224479

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5288442

entry.title: [codeql] Extend index_target.py to index multiple targets.
entry.content:
It would be useful for our researchers to be able to create a new,

targeted codeql database upon request.



With this refactoring, index_target.py's default behavior (triggered

primarily in automation) will be to index every target in the list of

targets_to_index.py.



For someone to generate a new codeql db, it will be as simple as adding

that gn target to targets_to_index.py and waiting for the next nightly

build.

entry.title: Always use the value stored in PrefetchContainer::referring_origin_
entry.content:
This CL modifies the current prefetch codebase to consistently utilize

the stored value in PrefetchContainer::referring_origin_ (which is set

to RenderFrameHost's LastCommittedOrigin during PrefetchContainer's

ctor), rather than calling LastCommittedOrigin again.

This change aims to be able to specify another appropriate value to it

as referring origin and use in prefetch codebase in the case of browser-

initiated prefetch, particularly CCT prefetch (for more context, see

this section [1]).



This CL doesn't intend to change any current behavior.



[1] https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ERDnAWMk9YG4tCeG-gZmgvh7sSm2_hQ6WtLRW085hh0/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.belsc69eifcj

entry.title: [ SavedTabGroup ] Fix crash when opening a group from overflow menu
entry.content:
Fixes a bug where clicking the "Open in new window" option from the context menu of a Saved group in the overflow menu would crash the browser.



This happens because when we try to open a group this way we set off a chain of observer commands, notifying the appropriate listeners along the way. Eventually the SavedTabGroupBar will be notified that one of its buttons has been updated and call Views::InvalidateLayout() which will redraw the buttons as well as close the overflow menu.



This destroys the button but because we had initiated this entire call stack from a callback we will continue where we left off. At that point, none of the private fields we would like to use have real values (UAF) causing our crash.



To prevent this UAF, we hold onto a pointer of the SavedTabGroup we are trying to open before we even open it. This way even if the button is destroyed and its fields have been freed we can still access the data through the pointer which still points to an object stored in the SavedTabGroupModel. The group cannot be deleted until after this call stack has finished so it is guaranteed to be real.



Change-Id: I04fd7d13bec7d5f21c944d924fc635e97ddf64a9

Bug: 324158367

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5311657

Reviewed-by: Taylor Bergquist

entry.title: CrOS Settings: Define a11y label and description for menu item
entry.content:
Currently, screen readers including Tast UI cannot differentiate between

the title and description of menu items. This CL updates menu items to

mirror the label and sublabel to the ARIA label and description

respectively, to be properly recognized by screen readers. Also

backfills several tests cases for the menu item element. The menu item

tooltip should not be read by screen readers in this case.

entry.title: Reduce UPF query memory consumption
entry.content:
Makes several changes to how unexpected pass finders handle data to

remove potential spikes in memory usage:



* Changes several loops to pop elements instead of using for/in so that

we don't temporarily end up with ~2x the memory usage

* Changes one usage of lists to sets to avoid increased memory usage

from duplicate entries.

entry.title: Update magic toolbar entrypoint if page is translated
entry.content:
This is a temporary solution for the MTB incorrectly remaining visible

when a page is translated to an unsupported language. It doesn't help

with the case where a page whose original language is unsupported is

translated to a supported language and may become readable. The fix for

that case requires sending a translation language with the readability

check, which will be implemented in several later changes.



This change assumes that a page that is readable in one supported

language will be readable in other supported languages, which seems to

be true so far.



Bug: 326287049, b/321252178

entry.title: [iOS] Add default abandonment metric that covers a longer period
entry.content:
Adds another metric variant for the post-default browser abandonment

metrics that covers a longer time window: 42 days - 21 days.



To avoid having too many trivial helpers in default browser utils, this

CL also gets rid of the variant-specific helpers in favor of letting

callers use the parameterized helper.



Finally, this CL tweaks the unit test covering the default abandonment

helper to be more focused on the boundary conditions, and to add more

checks for the new metric variant.

entry.title: Add special casing to enable VRR by-default for brya
entry.content:
This change toggles the default feature behavior (from disabled to

enabled) of EnableVariableRefreshRate for brya devices only. This is

required behavior to advance the finch experiment to LAUNCHED.



Because this change needs to affect brya hardware only, a special case

is added which checks the value of a new

kVariableRefreshRateDefaultEnabled feature flag (added by USE flags),

and ignores the usual default state of the kEnableVariableRefreshRate

feature. As long as the feature flag is not overridden and the

availability flag is set, the VRR feature will be enabled. Otherwise,

the feature state will be used as normal. This logic can be removed

later when the default behavior is enabled across all hardware.



Bug: b:310666603

Change-Id: I67c279adb1bb7d1d253950b2a5dea731e75b1a9f

entry.title: [rebaseline-cl] Warn when rebaselining tests missing locally
entry.content:
Without explicitly listed tests, the tests to rebaseline are derived

verbatim from failures reported by ResultDB. However, when using a

checkout older or newer than the try builds, it's possible for some

failed tests to not exist locally. Log a warning in that case.



This check is similar to but mutually exclusive with [0], which

requires that each explicit test pattern resolves to one or more tests.



[0]: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/tools/blinkpy/tool/commands/command.py;l=177-178;drc=f842bd21b70c17d9e1d886cbd3c5e765509615c5;bpv=0;bpt=0

entry.title: Audio: Fix AC3/AC4/DTS isTypeSupported() result for `video/mp4` mimetype
entry.content:
When mimetype = `audio/mp4`, the result is true if

supported, this is as expected. While when mimetype

= `video/mp4`, i.e:



MediaSource.isTypeSupported('video/mp4; codecs="ec-3"')

MediaSource.isTypeSupported('video/mp4; codecs="avc1.42E01E, ec-3"')



This should also return true if both video and audio

codecs are supported. Fix the issue by adding the

existed missing codec infos.

entry.title: bento_button: Remove screen width threshold for the desk button
entry.content:
The existing threshold logic for the desk button forces it to a zero

state when the screen width is less than 1280px to save shelf space.

This CL removes that threshold and only shrinks the button when the

shelf is overflown.



There are incoming efforts to make the button take the exact space it

needs. Once that's done, we can eliminate the expanded and zero states

entirely.
